title: Konrad Lorenz: science of animal behaviour
creator_credit: Jack Kaufman Productions and National Geographic Society
brief_description: Documents the work of Konrad Lorenz in animal behaviour, describing his studies with wild geese and his findings on the function of rank in animal social structure. Shows his experiments concerning imprinting and communication, where the geese adopt the experimenter as mother immediately after birth. Narrated by Leslie Nielsen.
